sec.title: International Centre of Nursing Ethics (ICNE) news
sec.p: ICNE is based in the Faculty of Health and Medical Sciences at the University of Surrey, Guildford, UK. It enables those engaged in all aspects of nursing ethics – empirical and philosophical – across the globe to collaborate on research and scholarship. In addition to initiating and promoting international research, the centre also hosts an annual conference, regular ethics seminars and a postgraduate professional ethics summer school.
Go to: http://www.nursing-ethics.org/

The 13th International ICNE Nursing ethics conference, co-hosted with the Hacettepe University Faculty of Health Sciences Nursing Department, will take place on 4–6 October 2012. The theme of the conference will be ‘Overcoming Challenges to Ethical Caring’. The venue of the conference is Surmeli Efes Hotel located in the resort city of Kusadasi, Izmir, Turkey. For more information on the conference, visit the following link:
Go to: http://www.icne2012.org/

sec.title: Intensive course in nursing ethics
sec.p: The Erasmus Mundus Master of Bioethics, the Center for Biomedical Ethics and Law and the Faculty of Medicine Katholieke Universiteit Leuven, Belgium, on 5–7 December 2012, offers a 3-day intensive course on ‘Foundational approaches, contemporary and educational issues in the field of nursing ethics’. As the title suggest, the objective of the course aimed at fostering exchanges on foundational and methodological approaches as well as contemporary and educational issues in nursing ethics. This course targets individuals from diverse professional backgrounds, such as nursing, medicine, philosophy and theology, health-care administration and PhD students undertaking courses of studies in these areas. For more information regarding course fee, registration and payment, please visit www.masterbioethics.org under intensive courses. Alternatively, you can contact Chris Gastmans (PhD) and Chantal De Keersmaecker via email at: Chantal.dekeersmaecker@med.kuleuven.be
